Contents
  1. Description
  2. Classes and Interfaces

Package application

package application
  • Classes
    Class
    Description
    AdminHomePage
    The AdminHomePage class represents the administrative dashboard in the application.
    AdminRequest
    Represents an admin request submitted by a user.
    AdminRequestDO
    A data object (DO) that stores raw admin request data retrieved from the database.
    AdminRequestPage
    The AdminRequestPage allows users to submit and manage admin requests.
    AdminRequestViewPage
    The AdminRequestViewPage class provides an admin-facing dashboard to view, close, and reopen user-submitted admin requests.
    AdminSetupPage
    The AdminSetupPage class allows the first user to create an admin account.
    Answer
    The Answer class is a model representing an answer to a question in the system.
    AnswerDO
    The AnswerDO (Data Object) class handles database operations related to answers.
    AskQuestionPage
    The AskQuestionPage class provides the user interface for submitting new questions.
    FirstPage
    The FirstPage class represents the initial screen shown when the application is launched for the first time.
    Flag
    The Flag class represents a user-submitted flag in the system.
    FlagDO
    The FlagDO class manages CRUD operations for Flag objects in the database.
    FlaggedContent
    The FlaggedContent class holds detailed information about flagged content in the system, such as questions or answers.
    InstructorHomePage
    The InstructorHomePage class provides the interface for instructor actions, including reviewing students' questions, reviewing messages, and managing ratings.
    InvitationPage
    The InvitationPage class displays a UI for students to invite instructors to review their submitted questions.
    Message
    The Message class models a message between users including sender, recipient, timestamp, and message content.
    MessageDO
    The MessageDO class handles database operations for messages, including sending, retrieving, and storing message objects.
    NameValidator
    The NameValidator class implements a finite state machine (FSM) to validate user names.
    PasswordEvaluator
    The PasswordEvaluator class validates passwords using a directed graph-based finite state machine.
    PasswordReset
    The PasswordReset class provides a UI page for resetting a user's password.
    Question
    The Question class represents a question submitted by a user.
    QuestionsDO
    The QuestionsDO class handles all database operations for question objects, including creation, retrieval, filtering, and deletion.
    RateReviewersPage
    The RateReviewersPage class provides a UI for students and instructors to rate reviewers using upvote/downvote buttons and see current ratings.
    Rating
    The Rating class represents a user's rating of a reviewer.
    RatingDO
    The RatingDO class manages the persistence and retrieval of reviewer ratings.
    Review
    The Review class represents a peer review of a question submitted by a student.
    ReviewDO
    The ReviewDO class provides database operations for review management, including creation, editing, and retrieval of review entries.
    ReviewerHomePage
    The ReviewerHomePage class defines the interface for reviewer users to explore questions, submit reviews, manage replies, and view feedback.
    ReviewerProfilePage
     
    ReviewRequestsPage
    The ReviewRequestsPage class allows instructors to view and respond to reviewer role requests.
    RolePickMenuPage
    The RolePickMenuPage class presents a menu for users with multiple roles to pick which role-specific homepage they wish to access.
    RoleSelectionPage
    The RoleSelectionPage class provides a user interface to select roles and saves them to the database for the given user.
    SetupAccountPage
    The SetupAccountPage class handles new account creation, including field validation and database registration logic.
    SetupLoginSelectionPage
    The SetupLoginSelectionPage class is a landing screen that lets users choose whether to register a new account or log in to an existing one.
    StaffHomePage
    The StaffHomePage class defines the UI for staff users to review and flag questions, answers, and messages, as well as manage admin requests.
    StartCSE360
    The StartCSE360 class is the main entry point for the JavaFX application.
    StudentHomePage
    The StudentHomePage class provides the main dashboard for student users, allowing them to interact with questions, replies, reviews, messages, and more.
    TrustedReviewerPage
    The TrustedReviewerPage class allows student users to manage their trusted reviewers.
    User
    The User class models a system user including credentials and assigned roles.
    UserHomePage
    The UserHomePage class displays a basic greeting interface after login, primarily for users with general or undefined roles.
    UserLoginPage
    The UserLoginPage class provides the login screen interface for users.
    UserNameRecognizer
    The UserNameRecognizer class implements a finite state machine (FSM) to validate usernames.
    ViewReviewersPage
    A JavaFX page that displays all users with the "reviewer" role in a table, along with the number of reviews they have given and any weight assigned by the current student.
    WelcomeLoginPage
    The WelcomeLoginPage class greets a logged-in user and allows navigation to appropriate role-based home pages or log out/quit.
